prompts.description: Game concept and implementation prompt for Lex Arena — a 10-level progressive lexical analysis trainer. Concept: students write regex patterns to tokenise source code with real-time visual feedback. Levels progress from integers → floats → identifiers → keywords → operators → strings → single-line comments → multi-line comments → whitespace → full combined lexer (capstone). Uses CodeMirror 5 for regex editor. Level 10 features a rule list editor with priority ordering.
prompts.notes: Design prompt generated for user review before implementation. Concept name: Lex Arena. Libraries chosen: CodeMirror 5 (CDN). No implementation files created yet.

prompts.description: Full implementation prompt for Lex Arena — 3 files (index.html, style.css, game.js). Detailed specification covering layout, theme, 10 levels, match checking algorithm, Level 10 rule-list editor with priority ordering, scoring, overlay system.
prompts.notes: AI timed out — spent too long generating the implementation. Same pattern as Artifact 3 (SQL parser) and Artifact 4 (CSS parser). No files were produced. Will need a revised prompt, possibly splitting the implementation into smaller parts.

prompts.description: Redesigned Lex Arena as a drag-and-drop regex builder game. 8 levels instead of 10. Students drag regex building blocks from a palette into a pattern builder strip — blocks snap together to form a regex tested in real-time. Zero external dependencies (CodeMirror removed). Level 8 capstone uses rule reordering with up/down buttons instead of full drag-and-drop rule editor.
prompts.notes: Major simplification to avoid implementation timeout. Removed CodeMirror dependency entirely. Reduced to 8 levels. Drag-and-drop blocks replace typed regex input. Generated implementation prompt for user review.

prompts.description: Implementation attempt of the revised drag-and-drop Lex Arena (8 levels, zero dependencies). User instructed AI to implement all 3 files.
prompts.notes: AI timed out again — took too long generating the implementation even after the simplified redesign. Two consecutive implementation failures for Artifact 5. Fourth timeout across the study (Art3-P2, Art4-P2, Art5-P2, Art5-P4).

prompts.description: Second design revision — user suggested using existing JS libraries instead of hand-coding lexer/regex/drag-drop from scratch. Identified 3 CDN libraries: moo.js (lexer engine — handles all tokenisation), SortableJS (drag-and-drop reordering), CodeMirror 5 (regex editor input). Revised 8-level concept: Levels 1-7 students type regex into CodeMirror, moo.js tokenises and highlights; Level 8 capstone uses SortableJS for rule priority reordering. game.js only needs level definitions, state machine, UI wiring.
prompts.notes: Key insight from user: timeouts caused by AI writing lexer/regex/drag-drop engines from scratch. Libraries chosen: moo.js 0.5.2 (tokeniser), SortableJS 1.15.0 (reordering), CodeMirror 5.65.18 (editor). Awaiting user approval to implement.

prompts.description: Third implementation attempt — using moo.js, SortableJS, and CodeMirror 5 to offload lexer/drag-drop/editor work. 8 levels.
prompts.notes: AI timed out again despite library-based strategy. Third consecutive implementation failure for Artifact 5. Fifth timeout across the study. The 3-file-at-once generation may be inherently too large — may need to generate one file at a time.

prompts.description: Minimal 1-level MVP implementation. Only Level 1 (INTEGER tokens). 3 files: index.html (68 lines), style.css (198 lines), game.js (246 lines). Uses CodeMirror 5 only. No moo.js or SortableJS needed for single level. Student types regex in CodeMirror, real-time match highlighting, token stream table, match bar, hints, reference chips, overlay system.
prompts.notes: Breakthrough: reduced to 1 level to fit within generation limits. All 3 files generated successfully. Strategy: build minimal working game first, then add remaining levels incrementally.

prompts.description: Added Level 2 (Go Float — FLOAT tokens) to the LEVELS array in game.js. Target regex: [0-9]+\.[0-9]+. Teaches escaped dot vs wildcard dot.
prompts.notes: Incremental level addition — only edited the LEVELS array. Same source code as Level 1. Starter pattern builds on Level 1 knowledge.

prompts.description: Added Levels 3 (Name Game — IDENTIFIER, target: [a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*) and 4 (Reserved Words — KEYWORD, target: \b(if|else|while|return|int|float)\b) to game.js LEVELS array. Teaches character classes with * quantifier and word boundaries with alternation.
prompts.notes: Both levels share same source code (if/else snippet). Level 3→4 progression teaches why keywords need word boundaries to distinguish from identifiers.

prompts.description: Added Levels 5 (Operators — [+\-*/<>=!&]{1,2}), 6 (Strung Along — "[^"]*"), and 7 (No Comment — \/\/.*|\/\*[\s\S]*?\*\/) to game.js LEVELS array. Teaches character class quantifiers, negated classes, and alternation with lazy quantifiers.
prompts.notes: 3 levels added in one prompt. Levels 5-6 share operator/string source. Level 7 introduces comment source. 7 of 8 levels complete — only capstone (Level 8: full lexer) remains.

prompts.description: Added Level 8 capstone (The Full Lexer). Modified all 3 files: index.html (rule-editor panel), style.css (rule-row styles), game.js (Level 8 data + setupRuleEditor + runCapstone + runLexer + multi-type highlighting). Students reorder 7 regex rules with up/down buttons, then run the lexer to tokenise a Fibonacci function.
prompts.notes: All 8 levels now complete. Starting manual testing.

observations: Starting manual testing at 22:08 UTC. Ended testing at 22:10 UTC.
challenges: Prompt 2 timed out — AI spent too long on implementation. Third consecutive artifact with a timeout on the first implementation attempt.

Prompt 4 timed out — even the simplified drag-and-drop redesign was too large for a single implementation prompt. May need to split into multiple prompts (e.g., HTML+CSS first, then game.js separately).
Root cause identified: AI was hand-coding lexer engine, regex matching, drag-and-drop from scratch. Solution: use moo.js, SortableJS, CodeMirror 5 via CDN.
Prompt 6 timed out — even with libraries, generating all 3 files in one prompt is too large. Must split into per-file prompts.
duration_estimate_note: Session wall-clock time approx 54 mins. WakaTime active editor time: 0 secs.
